text: David McNiven Garner (26 November 1928 â€“ 13 May 2016), was a New Zealand oceanographer. He worked as a published research physicist. He worked with a focus in physical oceanography and ocean circulation. In 1962, he founded the New Zealand Oceanographic Institute of the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research (today known as National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research), then located in Hobson Street, Wellington, New Zealand. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2016 deaths Category:New Zealand physicists
title: David McNiven Garner
